des:
This ShadeAuto skill for Amazon Alexa allows you to voice-activate individual Shades, Rooms of Shades, or specific Scenes created in the ShadeAuto app. 

To get started, you'll need a ShadeAuto app account with a ShadeAuto Hub. It's recommended to set up your ShadeAuto account and hub first in the ShadeAuto app. This ensures seamless account linking with Alexa.

Simply speak “Alexa" followed by the activation words "Activate", "Open", or "Close", and then the shade name or ShadeAuto Scene name.

Some example phrases are:

Individual Shade Command Examples
"Alexa, open shade name."
“Alexa, set shade name to 25 percent.”

Scene Command Examples
"Alexa, activate “Movie Time”.
“Alexa, run “Good Morning.”

Below are some tips for success when voice-activating using the ShadeAuto skill for Alexa:

- Make sure Shade names, Rooms, and Scene names are unique.
- Make your Shade names, Rooms, and Scene names easy to pronounce.
- Use Routines to combine multiple Shades, Rooms of Shades, or specific ShadeAuto Scenes with other devices for whole-home automation.
